results.title: Mister Prime Minister: Joseph Aloysius Lyons
results.creator_credit: Tom Haydon and Australian Broadcasting Commission
results.brief_description: The life and political career of J.A. Lyons, Prime Minister of Australia during 1932-1939, shown in contemporary film and stills. Narrated by Roger Climpson. Suitable for secondary level.

results.title: Mister prime minister: Alfred Deakin
results.brief_description: Provides an overview of Deakin’s life from his birth in a northern inner suburb of Melbourne in 1856 to his death in 1919, and closely examines his involvement in the Federation movement and his dominance of the first decade of Federal politics. Narrated by Roger Climpson.

results.title: Miss, Mrs, or Ms: what's it all about?
results.brief_description: Reports on the progress being made by feminist philosophies, showing that the stereotyping of traditional roles is decreasing in American society. Narrated by: Sylvia Chase, Christopher Glenn.

results.title: Miss Nelson is missing (K)
results.creator_credit: Frank Gladstone, Richard Rosen, Learning Corporation of America and Synatrak
results.brief_description: Miss Nelson is the nicest teacher in the school but her students are the worst behaved. When she suddenly does not come to school, a substitute teacher, Miss Viola Swamp, appears instead. Miss Swamp immediately lays down the law - no talking, no goofing, no free time. The students immediately begin a search for Miss Nelson, realising how wonderful she really is. They get nowhere, and are grateful on the day Miss Nelson mysteriously reappears. Animated and based on the book by Harry Allard, illustrated by James Marshall.

results.title: Miss Goodall and the wild chimpanzees
results.brief_description: Describes Jane Goodall and her studies as she observes and records the behaviour of wild chimpanzees in a forest reserve near Lake Tanganyika in Africa. Shows the chimpanzees engaged in both individual and social activities. Narrated by Orson Welles

results.title: Mirror of gesture
results.creator_credit: Edward Cornachio and University of California, Los Angeles
results.brief_description: Explores the relationships between two major artistic forms of India - sculpture and dance. Emphasises the artistic correspondences between the two media, but also demonstrates how effectively the rhythms of the dancer have been transformed into sculptural form.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Edward Cornachio and University of California, Los Angeles

results.title: Mirror in the sky
results.creator_credit: Alex Strasser, Basil Wright and Realist Films
results.brief_description: A story of research and discovery which, through the work of such scientists as Hertz, Marconi, Heaviside and - more particularly - Sir Edward Appleton, has led to the development of modern radio-communications. Some of the techniques which owe their origin to Appleton’s concept of the ionosphere are now being applied to radar, to reliable world-wide radio links, and more recently, to the science of radio-astronomy.

results.title: Mirage
results.creator_credit: Richard Raxlen, Tom Daly and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: An intriguing inside-out view of moving figures and images, made by using a colour negative print, but with more vivid colors and with accompanying sound effects that suggest the same kind of inversion of the sound track. Figures and faces appear in a shimmering haze; the one most frequently seen is a figure skater flashing, pirouetting, fading. These are shades of people and of movements, appearing, retreating, as in a mirage.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Richard Raxlen, Tom Daly and ONF | NFB

results.title: Miracle of the mountains
results.creator_credit: Dick Marks, Bob Blasdal, John Schindler and Fortitude Productions
results.brief_description: Working on no more than a bushman’s intuition Bernard O’Reilly battled for days over miles of dense and seemingly impenetrable rainforest to try and locate a downed Stinson airliner. After a two day battle with the elements he not only located the crashed Stinson but assisted in carrying out two of the survivors. Narrated by John Schindler.
